attributes.action: Re-instate the "married couples" tax allowance for ALL pensioners over 65.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When Gorden Brown abolished the married couples allowance for those born after April 1935 he gave little consideration to to those coming up to retirement age.
The result was an unfair system where the "young" pensioners (65-72) pay now around £600 tax/annum more than their older retired friends and relatives with similar/identical incomes.This (increasing) disparity will continue until the pension incomes wither to below the tax threshold....or death.
